availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

p.placeName: City and County of New York

body.p: I Edwin F. Corey Junior having been appointed by his Excellency the Governor of the State of Kentucky a Commisssioner to reside in the City of New York to take the acknowledgment of deeds or other instruments and to take affidavits depositions &c to be recorded or used in said State of Kentucky, do solemnly swear that I will well and faithfully execute and perform the duties as such Commission according to the best of my ability and in accordance with the laws of said State of Kentucky, So help me God.

figure.ab:
EDWIN F. COREY JR.
KENTUCKY
COMMISSIONER.

body.p: Subscribed and Sworn to before me this 12th day of February A D 1861

figure.ab:
EDWIN F. COREY
FOR
KENTUCKY
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS

body.p:
Edwin F Corey
Commissioner for the State of Kentucky in New York
